revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name=Kyle Mooney | image = Kyle Mooney by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Mooney at the 2017 [[San Diego Comic-Con]] | birth_name = Kyle James Kozub Mooney{{cite web|url=http://www.californiabirthindex.org/birth/kyle_jameskozub_mooney_born_1984_16455919|title=Kyle Jameskozub Mooney, Born 09/04/1984 in California - CaliforniaBirthIndex.org|publisher=Californiabirthindex.org|accessdate=6 October 2014}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|9|4}} | birth_place = [[San Diego, California]], U.S. | education = [[University of Southern California]] | occupation = Actor, comedian, writer | years active = 2007–present }} '''Kyle James Kozub Mooney''' (born September 4, 1984) is an American comedian, actor, and writer, who has been a cast member of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' since 2013.{{cite web|title=Mooney on SNL|url=http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/about/bio/kyle-mooney|publisher=NBC|accessdate=6 October 2014}} His man-on-the-street interviews have been featured on ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'' and ''[[Sports Show with Norm Macdonald]]''.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.miaminewtimes.com/cultist/2012/07/draft_kyle_mooney_is_the_ultim.php|title=Meet Kyle Mooney, the World's Most Awkward Miami Heat Fan (Video)|date=3 July 2012|work=Cultist|accessdate=6 October 2014}} Mooney has been a regular writer and performer at [[Upright Citizens Brigade]] since 2007.http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/credits/credit/season-42/kyle-mooney He also co-starred as Rory on the [[HBO]] comedy series ''[[Hello Ladies]].''{{cite web|title=Hello Ladies|url=http://www.hbo.com/hello-ladies/cast-and-crew/rory#/|publisher=HBO|accessdate=6 October 2014}} Mooney also starred in the film ''[[Brigsby Bear]]'', which he co-wrote.http://www.sltrib.com/home/4650047-155/utah-made-brigsby-bear-gets-into-sundance ==Early life== Mooney was born in [[San Diego, California]], to parents Linda (Kozub) and Brian Mooney. Linda is a former ''[[The San Diego Union-Tribune]]'' reporter, and Brian is an environmental consultant and planner.{{cite web|url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/Oct/02/saturday-night-live-kyle-mooney-bennett-att-cast/|title='SNL' season opens with local talent|work=U-T San Diego|accessdate=6 October 2014}} Mooney has two brothers, Sean and Ryan Mooney; he is the youngest of the three. Mooney is left-handed and nearsighted. Mooney's Marshall Middle School class chose him as the most likely to become a T.V. star.{{cite web|title=T.V. Star/Class Clown|url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/Oct/02/saturday-night-live-kyle-mooney-bennett-att-cast/|publisher=Diane Bell|accessdate=6 October 2014}} He graduated from [[Scripps Ranch High School]] in 2003, where he won Best Actor as Prospero in [[Shakespeare]]'s ''[[The Tempest]]''{{cite web|url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/11710|title=UCB Theatre • Kyle Mooney|publisher=Losangeles.ucbtheatre.com|accessdate=6 October 2014}} and was hailed as class clown. Mooney studied film at the [[University of Southern California]].{{cite news|url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/11710|title=Kyle Mooney|last=|first=|date=|work=[[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]]|accessdate=2013-08-24}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thrillist.com/los-angeles/entertainment/2010/12/14/good-neighbor|title=USC dudes make videos for your amusement|date=6 October 2014|work=thrillist|accessdate=6 October 2014}} There, he performed improv and sketch comedy with collegiate group [[Commedus Interruptus]]. After a six-week audition process in 2013,{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZWJL1r18heA|title=Commedus audition|publisher=Partners Project|accessdate=6 October 2014}} the three new members added to Commedus were Kyle Mooney, [[Beck Bennett]], and [[Nick Rutherford]].{{cite web|url=http://laist.com/2009/02/11/interview_friendly_comedy_from_good.php|title=Interview: Friendly comedy from Good Neighbor|work=LAist|accessdate=6 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106040222/http://laist.com/2009/02/11/interview_friendly_comedy_from_good.php|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=}} Mooney is a self described "collector" and owns a VHS collection which he started working on as a child, although the collection started for real during his freshman year of college. He currently has a giant bookshelf as well as a two smaller bookshelves that are packed with VHS tapes. Through connections made while working on SNL, Mooney is able to get his VHS tapes autographed by the actors who have starred in them. For example, Mooney owns a ''[[Beetlejuice]]'' VHS that has been signed by both [[Michael Keaton]] and [[Alec Baldwin]].https://www.gq.com/story/kyle-mooney-feels-pretty-good-about-his-alf-sweatshirt ==Career== ===Good Neighbor=== In 2007, Mooney, Bennett, and Rutherford came together to form the sketch comedy group Good Neighbor, along with Mooney's friend, director and editor [[Dave McCary]].{{cite web|url=http://dailytrojan.com/2011/01/23/student-comedy-group-grabs-attention/|title=Student comedy group grabs attention|work=Daily Trojan|accessdate=6 October 2014}} Bennett and Dave McCary joined Mooney on ''SNL'' in 2013 (as a performer and director, respectively), and Rutherford was hired as a writer the following year.{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2013/08/here-are-your-new-snl-featured-players/|title=Here Are Your New 'SNL' Featured Players – Splitsider|work=Splitsider|accessdate=6 October 2014}} In 2014, Good Neighbor was featured on [[New Media Rockstars]]' Top 100 Channels, ranked at #98.{{cite web|url=http://newmediarockstars.com/2014/12/the-nmr-top-100-youtube-channels-100-76/|title=The NMR Top 100 YouTube Channels: 100 – 76!|website=New Media Rockstars}} ===''Saturday Night Live''=== On September 28, 2013, Kyle Mooney made his debut on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' as a featured player.{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/09/29/tina-fey-snl-new-cast-members_n_4010798.html|title=Tina Fey Introduces New 'SNL' Cast Members In Season 39 Premiere|date=2013-09-29|work=Huffington Post|access-date=2018-01-28|language=en-US}} At the start of the [[Saturday Night Live (season 41)|forty-first season]], Mooney was upgraded to repertory status.{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2015/09/saturday-night-live-promotes-kyle-mooney-to-repertory-player-for-season-41/|title=‘Saturday Night Live’ Promotes Kyle Mooney to Repertory Player for Season 41|date=2015-09-23|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-01-28|language=en-US}} Mooney has brought some of his YouTube characters to ''SNL,'' including his person-on-the-street interviews, the "4/20 weed smoking guy" [[Recurring Saturday Night Live characters and sketches introduced 2013–2014#Chris Fitzpatrick|Chris Fitzpatrick]], Todd from ''Inside SoCal,'' and [[Recurring Saturday Night Live characters and sketches introduced 2013–2014#Bruce Chandling|Bruce Chandling]]. His celebrity impressions on ''Saturday Night Live'' include [[Jim Acosta]], [[Woody Allen]], [[Criss Angel]], [[Fred Astaire]], [[David Axelrod]], [[Jeff Bezos]], [[Neil Cavuto]], [[Lincoln Chafee]], [[Tom Cotton]], [[Michael Jackson]], [[Bruce Jessen]], [[Steve Jobs]], [[Chris Kirkpatrick]], [[Joey Lawrence]], [[Macklemore]], [[Chuck Norris]], [[Rand Paul]], [[Pope Francis]], [[Axl Rose]], [[Skrillex]], [[Stephen Stills]], and [[Steven Tyler]]. {{Cite web|url=http://snlarchives.net/Cast/?KyMo|title=SNL Archives {{!}} Cast {{!}} Kyle Mooney|website=snlarchives.net|access-date=2018-01-28}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
